official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act with respect to food produced from, containing,
			 or consisting of a bioengineered organism, the labeling of natural foods,
			 and for other purposes.

the organism is a plant (or a seed, a fruit, or any other part thereof);

the organism contains genetic material that has been modified through in vitro recombinant

the modification could not otherwise be obtained using conventional breeding techniques.

header.#text: Notification relating to certain bioengineered organisms

text.#text:
A bioengineered organism shall not be introduced or delivered for introduction into interstate
			 commerce for a food use or application unless—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:424/ss:d/p:2/sp:A

text.#text:
the use or application of the bioengineered organism in food has been addressed by the developer of
			 the bioengineered organism in a premarket biotechnology notification, to
			 which the Secretary has responded under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Safe and Accurate Food Labeling Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Safe and Accurate Food Labeling Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
voluntary
			 consultation process for foods and food products from genetically
			 engineered plants in effect prior to the date of enactment of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
informed the developer of the bioengineered organism that all questions about safety
			 have been resolved.

text.#text: the

This section does not apply with respect to the introduction or delivery for introduction into
			 interstate commerce of a bioengineered organism—

for the purpose of development or testing conducted to generate data and information that could be
			 used in a premarket biotechnology notification or other regulatory
			 submission; or
solely because—

a processing aid or enzyme produced from the bioengineered organism is intended to be used to
			 produce food; or

food produced from, containing, or consisting of the bioengineered organism is intended to be fed
			 to an animal from which food is intended to be produced or derived.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
by the
			 developer of the bioengineered organism. Such notification shall provide—

text.#text:

			 biotechnology notification shall be submitted to the

			 applicable, as one or more comparable marketed foods that are not produced
			 from, do not contain, or do not consist of such bioengineered organism;
			 and

whether any other Federal agency is conducting or has conducted any review of the bioengineered
			 organism and the status or conclusions of any such review.

determines that there is a material difference between a food produced from,

			 from being false or misleading, the

			 consumers of such material difference. The use of bioengineering does not,
			 by itself, constitute a material difference.

In this section:

term.#tail:
means, with respect to the food produced from, containing, or consisting of a plant that is a
			 bioengineered organism—

text.#text: The term
the parental variety of the plant;
another commonly consumed variety of the plant; or

a plant variety from which is derived a commonly consumed food with properties comparable to the
			 food produced from, containing, or consisting of the plant that is a
			 bioengineered organism.

A food produced from, containing, or consisting of a bioengineered organism may have more than one
			 comparable marketed food.

term.#tail: means the person who submits a premarket biotechnology notification.

The term

includes all scientific data and other information in the original submission and in any amendments

The term

results in a significantly different nutritional property in the food produced from, containing, or
			 consisting of the bioengineered organism; or

results in the food containing an allergen that consumers would not expect to be present based upon
			 the name of the food.

The amendments made by this section apply beginning on the date that is 30 days after the date of
			 enactment of this Act, irrespective of whether regulations or guidance
			 have been finalized or issued by such date to carry out such amendments.

header.#text: Labeling of whether food is bioengineered
Claims that bioengineering was not used

text.#text:
If a claim in the labeling of food indicates, directly or indirectly, that bioengineering was not
			 used in the production of the food, such claim shall be subject to this
			 subsection.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:425/ss:a/p:1

text.#text: A claim described in

may be made only if the food bearing the claim is comprised of ingredients subject to supply chain

the producer planting a seed developed by means other than through the use of bioengineering;
the producer keeping the crop separated during growth, harvesting, storage, and transportation; and
